docs.summary: Accept payments, initiate refunds, handle disputes.

permissions.name: Manage Disputes
permissions.description: Request permission to read transactions and manage disputes, including evidence upload

docs.summary: Accepts a dispute.

permissions.name: Manage Disputes
permissions.description: Request permission to read transactions and manage disputes, including evidence upload

params.name: evidence
params.doc: Evidence to include in the request.

params.name: idempotencyKey
params.doc: Use the same unique key when request retry is caused by technical issues like network availability.

docs.summary: Adds evidence to a dispute.

permissions.name: Manage Transactions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and capture payment transactions

params.name: amount
params.doc: Amount to capture in minor units (for example, cents). When not passed, the whole transaction amount will be captured.

params.name: capturableAmount
params.doc:
Amount that can be captured or voided in minor units to place a hold on a card to reserve funds.
 Specify the amount to prevent double partial captures.

params.name: externalCaptureId
params.doc: Corresponding capture ID within the external entity that initiated the transaction capture.

params.name: metadata
params.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata to store within the created capture.

docs.summary: Manually captures an authorized transaction by ID.

permissions.name: Manage Transactions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and capture payment transactions

params.name: paymentMethodTypeId
params.doc:
Type ID of payment method to use.
 Supported values are `creditCard`, `cardReader`, `ach`, `applePay`, `boleto`, `giropay`, `iDeal`, `payPal`, `pix`, `sepa`, `sofort`.
 Pass specific data for each payment method type using a corresponding parameter.
 For example, pass the parameter `card` when passing `creditCard` for this field.

params.name: amount
params.doc: Payment amount in minor units, for example, cents.

params.name: currency
params.doc: Payment currency according to ISO 4217. For example: USD, EUR, GBP.

params.name: externalTransactionId
params.doc: Corresponding transaction ID within the external entity that initiated the transaction.

params.name: externalInvoiceId
params.doc: Corresponding invoice ID within the external entity that made the request.

params.name: externalOrderId
params.doc: Order ID provided by the external entity that initiated the request.

params.name: externalBuyerId
params.doc: Customer ID provided by the external entity that initiated the request.

params.name: automaticCapture
params.doc: Whether to capture this transaction automatically. When not passed, the transaction can be manually captured later.

params.name: returnUrl
params.doc: URL to return to after redirection to the payment approval page.

params.name: installmentCount
params.doc: Number of installments (must be greater than 1 to trigger payment in installments).

params.name: riskData
params.doc: Payment information for the transaction's risk evaluation score.

params.name: externalFee
params.doc: Additional application-specific fee in minor units, for example, cents.

params.name: metadata
params.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata to store within the created transaction.

params.name: softDescriptor
params.doc: Complete description that appears on the customers' statements.

params.name: transactionType
params.doc: The type of transaction to perform.

docs.summary: Creates initial request for a transaction to authorize and optionally capture funds. Capture can be executed separately with an additional API call. Use this endpoint to execute one-time and [recurring payments]().

examples.title: Create authorization

extra.description: Create a transaction object and only authorize the funds

examples.title: Create authorization and capture

extra.description: Create a transaction object to authorize and capture funds

examples.title: Create authorization (setupCofOnSession)

extra.description: Create a transaction object and only authorize the funds with the intent for the subsequent transactions

permissions.name: Manage Refunds

params.name: amount
params.doc: Amount to capture in minor units (for example, cents). Leave empty to capture the whole transaction amount.

params.name: capturableAmount
params.doc:
Amount that can be captured or voided in minor units to place a hold on a card to reserve funds.
 Specify the amount to prevent double partial refunds.

params.name: refundableAmount
params.doc:
Amount in minor units that can be refunded.
 Specify the amount to prevent double partial refunds.

params.name: externalVoidOrRefundId
params.doc: Corresponding void or refund ID within the external entity that made the request.

params.name: metadata
params.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata to store within the created void or refund.

docs.summary: Voids or refunds the transaction by ID. Voids if the transaction was only authorized. Refunds if the transaction was already captured.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually a state, region, prefecture, or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number as free text.

docs.summary: Full contact details for an address

members.name: vatId
members.doc: tax info (Currently usable only in Brazil)

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the transaction is created.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: currency
members.doc: Payment currency according to ISO 4217. For example: USD, EUR, GBP.

members.name: capturableAmount
members.doc:
Amount that can be captured or voided in minor units.
 Usually matches authorization amount when the transaction has been authorized but not captured.

members.name: refundableAmount
members.doc:
Amount that can be refunded in minor units.
 Usually matches capture amount when the transaction has been captured but not refunded or charged back.

members.name: externalInvoiceId
members.doc: Invoice ID provided by the external entity that initiated the transaction.

members.name: externalOrderId
members.doc: Order ID provided by the external entity that initiated the transaction.

members.name: externalTransactionId
members.doc: Transaction ID provided by external entity.

members.name: providerTransactionId
members.doc: Transaction ID provided by the payment provider.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the transaction is created.

members.name: typeId
members.doc:
Type ID of payment method used.
 Supported values are `creditCard`, `cardReader`, `ach`, `applePay`, `boleto`, `giropay`, `iDeal`, `payPal`, `pix`, `sepa`, `sofort`.

members.name: displayName
members.doc:
Payment method display name.
 Can be masked card number or IBAN, wallet owner email address, etc.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Authorization amount in minor units, for example, cents.

members.name: statusReason
members.doc: Detailed reason for current authorization status when available. Value is empty for approved transactions.

members.name: networkReference
members.doc: Transaction reference provided by a payment network.

members.name: authCode
members.doc: Authorization code sent by a card issuer.

members.name: getMethodRedirect
members.doc: Next action: browser should issue an HTTP GET request and render the result.

members.name: postMethodRedirect
members.doc: Next action: browser should issue an HTTP POST request and render the result.

members.name: barcodeDisplay
members.doc: Next action: browser should show a barcode or a url to a barcode to continue payment.

members.name: qrCodeDisplay
members.doc: Next action: browser should show a QR code to continue payment.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the void was initiated.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: Void flow.

members.name: statusReason
members.doc: Detailed reason for current void status.

members.name: externalVoidId
members.doc: Void ID provided by the external entity.

members.name: providerVoidId
members.doc: Void ID provided by the payment provider.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the void was initiated.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the capture was created.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: Capture flow.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Capture amount in minor units, for example, cents.

members.name: statusReason
members.doc: Detailed reason for current capture status. Value is empty for approved transactions.

members.name: externalCaptureId
members.doc: Capture ID provided by the external entity that initiated the capture.

members.name: providerCaptureId
members.doc: Capture ID provided by the payment provider that initiated the capture.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the capture was created.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the refund was created.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: Refund flow.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Refund amount in minor units, e.g. cents.

members.name: statusReason
members.doc: Detailed reason for current refund status. Value is empty for approved transactions.

members.name: externalRefundId
members.doc: Refund ID provided by the external entity that initiated the refund.

members.name: providerRefundId
members.doc: Refund ID provided by the payment provider that initiated the refund.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata stored when the refund was created.

docs.summary: Dispute flow.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Dispute amount in minor units, for example, cents.

members.name: statusReason
members.doc: Detailed reason for current refund status.

members.name: providerDisputeId
members.doc: Dispute ID provided by the payment provider that initiated the dispute.

members.name: rfi
members.doc: Date/time frames for RFI (request for information) flow.

members.name: openingDate
members.doc: Pre arbitration (request for information) received date.

members.name: resolutionDate
members.doc: Date that Pre arbitration resolution occurred (final dispute status).

members.name: daysToResolution
members.doc: Number of days between evidence submission and final decision for a dispute.

members.name: resolutionDate
members.doc: Date that RFI resolution occurred (final dispute status).

members.name: daysToResolution
members.doc: Number of days between evidence submission and final decision for a dispute.

members.name: resolutionDate
members.doc: Date a dispute was lost (accepted, expired, etc.) or date of dispute final resolution.

members.name: providerResponse
members.doc: Original response code from the issuer or card scheme.

members.name: networkTransactionId
members.doc: Transaction ID assigned by a card scheme (Trace ID for Mastercard or Transaction ID for Visa).

members.name: dsTransactionId
members.doc: Transaction ID assigned by 3D Secure 2 directory server.

members.name: networkReference
members.doc: Transaction reference provided by a payment network.

docs.summary: Authorize and capture transaction.

members.name: value
members.doc: amount in minor units to be charged for future payments

members.name: type
members.doc:
if `FIXED`, the `amount` parameter refers to the exact amount to be charged in future payments
 if `MAXIMUM`, the amount charged can be up to the value passed for the `amount` parameter

members.name: startDate
members.doc: start date of the mandate or subscription

members.name: endDate
members.doc: end date of the mandate or subscription. If not provided, the mandate will be active until canceled

members.name: count
members.doc:
the number of intervals between payments. For example, `type=MONTH` and `count=3` indicates one payment every three months
 maximum of one year interval allowed (1 year, 12 months, or 52 weeks)
 this parameter is optional only when `type=SPORADIC`

members.name: description
members.doc: a description of the mandate or subscription that is meant to be displayed to the customer

members.name: interval
members.doc: specifies time ranges for future payments

members.name: mandateOptions
members.doc: a record of the permission a customer has given to debit his payment method

members.name: mandateOptions
members.doc: a record of the permission a customer has given to debit his payment method

docs.summary: Card payment.

members.name: expiryYear
members.doc: Card expiration year (4 digits, for example, 2022, 2025).

members.name: holderName
members.doc: Cardholder name printed on the card.

docs.summary: iDEAL is an online payment method that enables consumers to pay online through their own bank in the Netherlands.

members.name: issuingBank
members.doc: Code of the specified issuing bank to process transaction.

docs.summary: SOFORT bank transfer payment data.

members.name: bankAccountOwnerName
members.doc: Name of the bank account owner.

docs.summary: PayPal account used for payment.
Card Reader payment method info.

members.name: lastDigits
members.doc: The last 4 digits of the card number.

members.name: expiryYear
members.doc: Card expiration year (4 digits, for example, 2022, 2025).

members.name: holderName
members.doc: Cardholder name printed on the card.

members.name: brandId
members.doc:
Card issuer's brand.
 Supported values are `MasterCard`, `Visa`, `Electron`, `Amex`, `Diners`, `Discover`, `Jcb`, `ChinaUnionPay`, `Maestro`, `CartesBancaires`.

docs.summary: Integrate a mobile payment and digital wallet service by Apple Inc. that allows users to make payments in person, in iOS apps, and on the web although.

members.name: expiryYear
members.doc: Full year of the D-PAN card expiration date.

members.name: expiryMonth
members.doc: Month of the D-PAN card expiration date.

members.name: onlinePaymentCryptogram
members.doc: Online payment cryptogram aka 3ds 2.0 challenge result.

docs.summary: Manage your offline business with the Wix Payments solution.
Boleto Bancário, commonly known as Boleto, is a popular Brazilian cash-based payment method.
Pix is a popular Brazilian QR Code based payment method.
The Single Euro Payments Area (SEPA) is a payment-integration initiative of the European Union for simplification of bank transfers denominated in euro.
The ACH network.

members.name: bankRoutingNumber
members.doc: Bank routing number of the account.

members.name: bankAccountOwnerName
members.doc: The name on the bank account.

members.name: unitPrice
members.doc: Single item price in minor units (e.g., cents).

messages.name: riskProviderDataMapEntry
messages.displayName: risk Provider Data Map Entry Object

docs.summary:
Set of key-value pairs. Provider-specific data. Available keys:
 forter_token_cookie – Token cookie provided by Forter SDK
 forter_mobile_uid - Device identifier such as IMEI for Android or vendor identifier for iOS. The deviceId sent via mobile events API must be passed for this field. For mobile transactions only.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

docs.summary: Additional information regarding a payment to properly evaluate risk score of the transaction.

members.name: userAgent
members.doc: "User-Agent" HTTP header of a buyer request (**required**).

members.name: referrerHeader
members.doc: "Referrer" HTTP header of a buyer request (**required**).

members.name: acceptHeader
members.doc: "Accept" HTTP header of a buyer request.

members.name: firstEmailPurchaseDate
members.doc: Timestamp of first purchase from this buyer's email.

members.name: firstIpPurchaseDate
members.doc: Timestamp of first purchase using the same IP address.

members.name: merchantCreatedDate
members.doc: Creation date of the merchant within the request originator.

members.name: siteCreatedDate
members.doc: Creation date of the site where customer made the purchase.

members.name: fulfillmentDate
members.doc: Fullfilment date of the purchased event.

members.name: riskProviderData
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs. Provider-specific data. Available keys:
 forter_token_cookie – Token cookie provided by Forter SDK
 forter_mobile_uid - Device identifier such as IMEI for Android or vendor identifier for iOS. The deviceId sent via mobile events API must be passed for this field. For mobile transactions only.

members.name: url
members.doc: Encoded URL to perform an HTTP GET request.

members.name: url
members.doc: Encoded URL to perform an HTTP POST request.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Non-encoded form fields to send with the POST request using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded content type.

docs.summary: Barcode additional data.
QR code data.

members.name: payload
members.doc:
QR code raw text payload.
You can use any QR code generator library to convert it to an image.
To see more details read [this article](https://www.thonky.com/qr-code-tutorial/introduction).

docs.summary: Amount breakdown.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type string

members.name: paymentMethodTypeId
members.doc:
Type ID of payment method to use.
 Supported values are `creditCard`, `cardReader`, `ach`, `applePay`, `boleto`, `giropay`, `iDeal`, `payPal`, `pix`, `sepa`, `sofort`.
 Pass specific data for each payment method type using a corresponding parameter.
 For example, pass the parameter `card` when passing `creditCard` for this field.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Payment amount in minor units, for example, cents.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Payment currency according to ISO 4217. For example: USD, EUR, GBP.

members.name: externalTransactionId
members.doc: Corresponding transaction ID within the external entity that initiated the transaction.

members.name: externalInvoiceId
members.doc: Corresponding invoice ID within the external entity that made the request.

members.name: externalOrderId
members.doc: Order ID provided by the external entity that initiated the request.

members.name: externalBuyerId
members.doc: Customer ID provided by the external entity that initiated the request.

members.name: automaticCapture
members.doc: Whether to capture this transaction automatically. When not passed, the transaction can be manually captured later.

members.name: returnUrl
members.doc: URL to return to after redirection to the payment approval page.

members.name: installmentCount
members.doc: Number of installments (must be greater than 1 to trigger payment in installments).

members.name: riskData
members.doc: Payment information for the transaction's risk evaluation score.

members.name: externalFee
members.doc: Additional application-specific fee in minor units, for example, cents.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. Metadata to store within the created transaction.

members.name: softDescriptor
members.doc: Complete description that appears on the customers' statements.

members.name: transactionType
members.doc: The type of transaction to perform.

members.name: setupCofOnSession
members.doc: On-session payment followed by the storing of credentials to enable future transactions initiated by the cardholder. For example, one-click purchases.

members.name: setupCofRecurring
members.doc: On-session payment followed by the storing of credentials to enable future recurring transactions initiated by the merchant. For example, regular subscription charges.

members.name: setupCofUnscheduled
members.doc: On-session payment followed by the storing of credentials to enable future unscheduled transactions initiated by the merchant. For example, automatic top-ups.

members.name: cofOnSession
members.doc: On-session transaction initiated by the cardholder. For example, a one-click purchase.

members.name: cofRecurring
members.doc: Off-session recurring transaction initiated by the merchant. For example, a regular subscription charge.

members.name: cofUnscheduled
members.doc: Off-session unscheduled transaction initiated by the merchant. For example, an automatic top-up.

members.name: cardReader
members.doc: Point of sale with Wix Payments.

members.name: ideal
members.doc: iDEAL is an online payment method in Netherlands.

members.name: applePay
members.doc: Mobile payment and digital wallet service provided by Apple Inc.

members.name: boleto
members.doc: Boleto Bancário, commonly known as Boleto, is a popular Brazilian cash-based payment method.

members.name: sepa
members.doc: The Single Euro Payments Area (SEPA) is a payment-integration initiative of the European Union for simplification of bank transfers denominated in euro.

members.name: pix
members.doc: Pix is a popular Brazilian QR Code based payment method.

members.name: tokenized
members.doc: payment method tokenized by caller and it's token is passed instead

docs.summary:
tax info types Possible values are:
  • UNSPECIFIED
  • CPF - CPF - for individual tax payers
  • CNPJ - CNPJ - for corporations

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_SUBDIVISION_TYPE
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_1 - State
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_2 - County
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_3 - City/town
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_4 - Neighborhood/quarter
  • ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_5 - Street/block
  • COUNTRY - ADMINISTRATIVE_AREA_LEVEL_0. Indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder.

Possible values are:
  • OTHER
  • FRAUD
  • COMPLIANCE
  • DUPLICATE_PAYMENT
  • ABANDONED_PAYMENT
  • MERCHANT_REQUEST
  • BUYER_REQUEST

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PROCESSING
  • DECLINED
  • SUCCEEDED
  • CANCELED
  • NEEDS_ACTION
  • PENDING

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PENDING
  • FAILED
  • SUCCEEDED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PENDING
  • FAILED
  • SUCCEEDED
  • REVERSED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • PENDING
  • FAILED
  • SUCCEEDED
  • REVERSED
  • CANCELED

Possible values are:
  • OTHER
  • FRAUD_CARD_PRESENT
  • FRAUD_CARD_ABSENT
  • DUPLICATE_PROCESSING
  • SERVICES_NOT_PROVIDED
  • CANCELED_RECURRING
  • NOT_AS_DESCRIBED
  • COUNTERFEIT
  • MISREPRESENTATION
  • CANCELED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • RFI_OPEN
  • RFI_UNDER_REVIEW
  • RFI_CLOSED
  • CHARGEBACK_OPEN
  • CHARGEBACK_UNDER_REVIEW
  • WON
  • LOST
  • PRE_ARBITRATION_UNDER_REVIEW
  • PRE_ARBITRATION_WON
  • PRE_ARBITRATION_LOST

Possible values are:
  • OTHER
  • ACCESS_ACTIVITY_LOG
  • BILLING_ADDRESS
